body:
Got the same here where I can't navigate the cmdline properly, I don't think this is related to neovim :)
→ and ← always skip a character for me.
Can someone try `alacritty --config-file /dev/null`?
Could not observe the ←→ behaviour with `alacritty --config-file /dev/null`
I feel like we broke config serialization a bit. I feel like you have bindings for arrow keys, etc right in the config.
Yeah, it's a problem with binding replacing, since I doubt anyone tested it with bindings from `v0.3.3`, but it seems like you're ending up with 2 bindings for alt-screen for arrow key, somehow.

As a workaround, adding `|~Vi` to `mode` for the `Right`, `Left`, `Up`, and `Down` bindings in your config should solve your problem.

For example:

```yaml
  - { key: Right, chars: "\x1b[C", mode: ~AppCursor|~Vi}
  - { key: Right, chars: "\x1bOC", mode: AppCursor|~Vi  }
```

These bindings are also built in by default now, so simply removing them is perhaps a good idea.

This actually works as expected tbqh. So the only thing we can do is to relax our rules even more and not consider `modes` during config update state.

Anyway, I'd just recommend to sync your bindings with current default ones.

Could someone explain more specifically what changed that necessitates this change to our keybinding configuration? It's going to be a bit annoying to now have to synchronize the alacritty version upgrade with this config file change.

We added one more mode and changed all default bindings modes to reflect that, we're working to create some solution so really old bindings configuration could still kind of work https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/3479.

note: we're not at 1.0.0 so no one guaranties that we won't break bindings/config before that.

I'd strongly recommend removing configuration options you have not set yourself from your configuration file. Every option has a default value, so this is perfectly safe to do.

Doing so, will prevent things like this from ever affecting you, unless we explicitly decide to change an existing option you have manually set yourself.

There probably will be a fix for this specific issue before the 0.5.0 release, but that doesn't change that removing default bindings is a good idea anyways.

issue.title: Arrow up key when pressed once acts like pressed twice
issue.body:
So when I press arrow up to move in my console history cursors moves twice.
That happens in zsh, vim and other apps controlled by alacritty.

### System

OS: Linux/BSD/macOS/Windows
Version: `alacritty --version` output
Linux/BSD: X11/Wayland, DE or Compositor and WM
Windows: WinPTY/ConPTY (see `alacritty -v` output)

```
❯ /Applications/Alacritty.app/Contents/MacOS/alacritty --version
alacritty 0.5.0-dev (1ddd311)
```


### Logs

Crashes: STDERR, STDOUT
Font/Terminal size: `alacritty -vv`
Keyboard and bindings: `alacritty --print-events`

```
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.046639000] [INFO] glutin event: MainEventsCleared
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.046653000] [INFO] glutin event: RedrawEventsCleared
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.053507000] [INFO] glutin event: NewEvents(WaitCancelled { start: Instant { t: 250874180633527 }, requested_resume: None })
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.053718000] [INFO] glutin event: DeviceEvent { device_id: DeviceId(DeviceId), event: Motion { axis: 0, value: -1.0 } }
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.053752000] [INFO] glutin event: DeviceEvent { device_id: DeviceId(DeviceId), event: MouseMotion { delta: (-1.0, 0.0) } }
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.053779000] [INFO] glutin event: WindowEvent { window_id: WindowId(Id(140286281138304)), event: CursorMoved { device_id: DeviceId(DeviceId), position: PhysicalPosition { x: 783.578125, y: 567.3125 }, modifiers: (empty) } }
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.053798000] [INFO] glutin event: MainEventsCleared
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.053811000] [INFO] glutin event: RedrawEventsCleared
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.063827000] [INFO] glutin event: NewEvents(WaitCancelled { start: Instant { t: 250874187791874 }, requested_resume: None })
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.064055000] [INFO] glutin event: DeviceEvent { device_id: DeviceId(DeviceId), event: Motion { axis: 0, value: -1.0 } }
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.064090000] [INFO] glutin event: DeviceEvent { device_id: DeviceId(DeviceId), event: MouseMotion { delta: (-1.0, 0.0) } }
[2020-03-19 09:53:25.064109000] [INFO] glutin event: WindowEvent { window_id: WindowId(Id(140286281138304)), event: CursorMoved { device_id: DeviceId(DeviceId), position: PhysicalPosition { x: 781.5546875, y: 567.3125 }, modifiers: (empty) } }
```

body: Also appears in htop

For everyone pinging that issue. This is not really an issue that we broke a config file from a `v0.3.3` version, you **don't need custom bindings to make arrow keys working**, all bindings are builtin inside of alacritty for a long time already, so you should only define the ones you actually created yourself or fix old bindings by fixing their mode properly (by adding `mode: ~Vi` to them), instead of bumping this "issue" with your very old bindings.
I might have misunderstood you, but what if I never changed my keybindings?

Well, than it's time to change them if you want this issue fixed(just look at our default config), as I said, we're working on some fix to remove builtin bindings more aggressively, which will break some new bindings in this particular case, since we have arrow keys now mapped in addition in `Vi` mode. just remove all your bindings if you've never changed them and it'll work just fine.

Note, there's no guarantee that we won't break bindings before `v1.0.0`, it wasn't even a break, since our logic works as expected. And you're expected to have 2 mappings with old bindings now, because they differ from new builtin ones.

FWIW, once we've landed on the exact behavior that's changing in 0.5 we should make it clear what (if any) steps are needed to update existing configurations in the CHANGELOG.

That said, most people will be happiest by simply deleting their old default bindings, as mentioned above.

I have this problem outside of vim/neovim. 

I use zsh shell. If I press _any_ arrow key, It is reacted to, twice. So, Pressing left/right jumps 2 steps back/forward and pressing up/down steps by 2 entries in zsh history. 

Alacritty version, alacritty-git 0.5.0.1500.g1a8cd172-1(from AUR).

As a temporary fix, I have reverted back to 0.4.2 and this fixes the problem for me. I'll just upgrade later at some point when this is fixed. 

Please let me know if any one here needs more information. I'd love to help. :)
Just remove bindings from config and it should be fixed.

I'm also seeing this - as a workaround I've reverted back to 64db7d3da, which is fine for now.

Do you have any tips on which keybinds are likely to be broken, or what I should be looking for in my config?

Most of what's in my config is what Alacritty created for me, but I don't really remember what is the default and what I added in, so any tips would be appreciated.
